statement.para: The position vector of the point X(3,1) in \RNr[2] is \mathbf{x}=(3,1).

answer.para: Indeed, the arrow joining the origin to X goes, starting from its tail, 3 units in the first coordinate direction and from there 1 unit in the second coordinate direction. The corresponding coordinate vector is \mathbf{x}=(3,1).

statement.para: The point X(7,-5,2) in \RNr[3] has the position vector \mathbf{x} = (7,-5,2).

answer.para: The position vector \mathbf{x} of X is represented by the arrow whose tail is at the origin and whose tip is at X. Therefore \mathbf{x}=(7,-5,2).
